body: You shouldn't manually assign values to `@CreateDateColumn` and `@UpdateDateColumn`, their values are automatically controlled by ORM when you insert a new entity or update it
i agree with @wederer, there are times when it would be nice to manually override the value of an `@UpdateDateColumn`.
its not supposed for it, just write create a regular date column column and set date you need when you need
@pleerock this should be better documented then. I will open up a PR for documentation changes. Please leave the issue open until then.
Use `repository.update()` to override column values with `@CreateDateColumn` and `@UpdateDateColumn` programatically in automated tests.

issue.title: Repository update does not respect readonly flag on CreateDateColumn or UpdateDateColumn

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.title: set default value for created_at in code and not in schema

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
**Issue type:**

[x] question
[ ] bug report
[ ] feature request
[ ] documentation issue

**Database system/driver:**

[ ] `cordova`
[ ] `mongodb`
[ ] `mssql`
[x] `mysql` / `mariadb`
[ ] `oracle`
[ ] `postgres`
[ ] `sqlite`
[ ] `sqljs`
[ ] `react-native`
[ ] `expo`

**TypeORM version:**

[x] `latest`
[ ] `@next`
[ ] `0.x.x` (or put your version here)

I want to automatically populate the created_at and updated_at columns.

```
    import {BaseEntity, CreateDateColumn, PrimaryGeneratedColumn, UpdateDateColumn} from "typeorm"
    import {Moment} from "moment"
    import {momentTransformer} from "../helpers/transformers"
    
    export default abstract class Model extends BaseEntity {
        @PrimaryGeneratedColumn()
        id: number
    
        @CreateDateColumn({type: "timestamp", transformer: momentTransformer})
        created_at: Moment
    
        @UpdateDateColumn({type: "timestamp", transformer: momentTransformer})
        updated_at: Moment
    }
```

How can I set a default value (current time) that is used for the sql query without altering the DB schema. I,e. I want the code to set the value and not the DB. The code above results in the following query:

`INSERT INTO `someTable`(`id`, `created_at`, `updated_at`) VALUES (DEFAULT, DEFAULT, DEFAULT)`

body: It would be a nice option to be able to override the values for generating fake test data.
@tinaroh did you ever find a work around for this?

Another use case  data migration from one DB to another, while trying to preserve these values from the source database.

To workaround this I use `.insert()` instead of `.save()`

issue.title: docs: specify that columns using CreateDateColumn/UpdateDateColumn cannot be set manually

repository.name: typeorm
repository.description: ORM for TypeScript and JavaScript. Supports MySQL, PostgreSQL, MariaDB, SQLite, MS SQL Server, Oracle, SAP Hana, WebSQL databases. Works in NodeJS, Browser, Ionic, Cordova and Electron platforms.

issue.body:
Follows the discussion on #3365.

Columns using the decorators `@CreateDateColumn()` and `@UpdateDateColumn()` cannot have their values manually set. This behaviour is not documented in the docs.

This PR documents that behaviour.

body: Since this feature is highly requested, we will land it in `0.2.25`. It's going to be closed by #5867
